    <title><![CDATA[NDP leader attacks web giants, defends taxes in equality call-to-arms]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/ndp-leader-attacks-web-giants-defends-taxes-in-equality-call-to-arms-1.3807928</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Jagmeet Singh has issued a call-to-arms against inequality as he sought to put his stamp on the federal NDP on Saturday by taking aim at the Trudeau government and foreign web giants while offering a full-fledged defence of taxes and public services.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Lee Berthiaume]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807928</guid>
    <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:02:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 20:33:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3808021.1518902396!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[ Federal NDP leader Jagmeet Singh addresses convention in Ottawa.]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA['No place' for racism in justice system, minister says]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/no-place-for-racism-in-justice-system-minister-says-1.3807427</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould says she’s determined to rid Canada’s criminal justice system of racism. ]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Rachel Aiello]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[Ottawa News Bureau Online Producer]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807427</guid>
    <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 07:00:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 07:00:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807457.1518826953!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould on CTV's Question Period. ]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Canada seeks meeting with Indian politician over Sikh separatist claims]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/canada-seeks-meeting-with-indian-politician-over-sikh-separatist-claims-1.3808412</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The Canadian government is now seeking a meeting with the Indian politician who publicly accused members of Trudeau's cabinet of being connected to the Sikh separatist movement.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Mia Rabson]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3808412</guid>
    <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 07:50:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:42:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3808414.1518958141!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Defence Minister Harjit Sajjan poses with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau in front of the Taj Mahal in India. (Harjit Sajjan / Twitter)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Former NDP MP Paul Dewar is undergoing treatment for brain cancer]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/former-ndp-mp-paul-dewar-is-undergoing-treatment-for-brain-cancer-1.3807933</link>
    <description><![CDATA[A former NDP member of parliament says he underwent surgery after being diagnosed with brain cancer.]]></description>
    <author></author>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807933</guid>
    <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:16:00 -0500</pubDate>

THE CANADIAN PRESS/Adrian Wyld]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Pot could be legal June 7, but sales delayed until at least August: Senator]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/pot-could-be-legal-june-7-but-sales-delayed-until-at-least-august-senator-1.3808111</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Cannabis could be legal for recreational use as soon as June 7, but Canadians will likely have to wait until at least early August to purchase it, says independent Ontario Senator Tony Dean. ]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel Otis]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[CTVNews.ca Writer]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3808111</guid>
    <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 18:30:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 18:46:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.2881978.1462042326!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Marijuana is weighed at a medical marijuana dispensary, in Vancouver, Wednesday, Feb. 5, 2015. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jonathan Hayward]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Mulroney, Ford not ready to lead Ont. PC party: Elliott ]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/mulroney-ford-not-ready-to-lead-ont-pc-party-elliott-1.3807269</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Ontario PC leadership candidate Christine Elliott is taking aim at her competition, saying that she’s the only one who has “the knowledge and the experience” to lead her party to victory in June. ]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Daniel Otis]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[CTVNews.ca Writer]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807269</guid>
    <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 07:00:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 07:00:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807318.1518823197!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Ontario PC leadership candidate Christine Elliott speaks with CTV Question Period host Evan Solomon in an interview that airs Sunday. ]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Trudeau takes wing on trade mission to India, where Sikh politics loom]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/trudeau-takes-wing-on-trade-mission-to-india-where-sikh-politics-loom-1.3806661</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is on his way to India, where he plans to spend the next week buttressing Canada's cultural and economic ties with the burgeoning South Asian nation.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Mia Rabson]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3806661</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 12:28:18 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 12:28:18 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3806677.1518801831!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, right, departs Ottawa with his wife Sophie Gregoire Trudeau, left to right, and children Xavier, Ella-Grace and Hadrien on Friday, Feb. 16, 2018., en route to India. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Sean Kilpatrick]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[NDP kicks off convention with sobering report on fundraising]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/ndp-kicks-off-convention-with-sobering-report-on-fundraising-1.3806963</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The federal NDP kicked off its national convention in earnest Friday with a sober apology from the party's president to all those New Democrats who have suffered harassment or discrimination.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Lee Berthiaume]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3806963</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:00:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:21:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807256.1518821768!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Jagmeet Singh Leader of the NDP shakes hands with delegates as arrives at the NDP convention in Ottawa, Friday, February 16, 2018.THE CANADIAN PRESS/Fred Chartrand]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Notley wants action on B.C. pipeline impasse by next week]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/notley-wants-action-on-b-c-pipeline-impasse-by-next-week-1.3807323</link>
    <description><![CDATA[Alberta Premier Rachel Notley says she wants progress soon in the impasse between her province and British Columbia over the Trans Mountain pipeline or she will ratchet up the pressure.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Dean Bennett]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807323</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:28:56 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:28:56 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807335.1518823678!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[Alberta Premier Rachel Notley makes remarks before the first meeting of the Market Access Task Force, convened to respond to B.C. in the fight over the Trans Mountain oil pipeline, in Edmonton Alta, on Wednesday February 14, 2018. (THE CANADIAN PRESS / Jason Franson)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
              <item>
    <title><![CDATA[Social conservatives find new voice in Ontario as Tory candidates duke it out]]></title>
    <link>https://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/social-conservatives-find-new-voice-in-ontario-as-tory-candidates-duke-it-out-1.3807224</link>
    <description><![CDATA[The emergence of a Tory leadership candidate committed to repealing Ontario's sex-ed curriculum may yet see the Progressive Conservative party, which was pushed to the centre under former leader Patrick Brown, shifting to the right -- at least until the spring election campaign gets underway.]]></description>
    <author></author>
          <dc:creator><![CDATA[Shawn Jeffords and Colin Perkel]]></dc:creator>
              <creditLine><![CDATA[ The Canadian Press]]></creditLine>
            <guid isPermaLink="false">1.3807224</guid>
    <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 17:45:00 -0500</pubDate>
        <ctv:lastModifiedDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:00:00 -0500</ctv:lastModifiedDate>  
        			           <enclosure url="https://www.ctvnews.ca/polopoly_fs/1.3807228.1518820891!/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_300/image.jpg"><![CDATA[PC Ontario Leadership candidate Tanya Granic Allen scrums with journalists at the TVO studios Toronto on Thursday, Feb.15, 2018 following a televised debate with fellow candidates Christine Elliott, and Doug Ford and Caroline Mulroney. (Chris Young/THE CANADIAN PRESS)]]></enclosure>
		 		         </item>
        </channel>
